topic.title: ITS_PKT500 Overview

body.p: The Integrated Test Set 500G Packet Tester (ITS_PKT500) generates and monitors up to 500 Gbps of packet traffic carried over up to 120 channels. The ITS_PKT500 generates packets with programmable payloads and programmable sequences of packet lengths for each channel. Each generated channel can be configured to include optional packet overhead fields including an incrementing packet sequence number for packet order validation, a timestamp for path latency testing, and a static field per channel for channel differentiation. The generator inserts an optional FCS over a selected portion of the payload to enable data validation. The ITS_PKT500 monitors each channel as it checks the packet sequence fields for continuity, checks the static field against the expected value, and checks the FCS in the packet against its own FCS calculated over the selected portion of the payload. The packet monitor can extract the timestamp from a selected channel and compare it to the internal timestamp counter to calculate end to end path latency for the channel. The packet generators and monitors provide per channel counters and interrupts for packets and bytes sent and received, and for flow control status and data errors detected in the monitor. The ITS_PKT500 uses channelized XOFF flow control backpressure, and channel level credit-based rate limiters to produce controlled channel data rate profiles.
